climbs.name: Wet and Dirty (direct start)
climbs.fa: Adam Winslow, Kyle Silverman, Bill Coe 3/20/09

content.description: Start on the left side of the vertical block that forms the base of the ramp for Wet and Dirty. Joins the regular route after about 10' of pleasant climbing.

climbs.name: Wet and Dirty
climbs.fa: Kyle Silverman, Bill Coe, Adam Winslow 3/20/09

content.description: Climb up to the left slanting ramp just to the right of 30(1) Feet of Pleasure.
content.protection: #1 and #2 camalot and a few other pieces will get you to the shared anchor for the routes just left of this one (traverse left and under the log).

content.description: Actually rated 5.2+  Follow the easy ramp up 60 feet to a large fir tree near the trail. Surprisingly solid rock was found after digging through 6" of dirt on a ground-up first ascent. Many thanks to Wes Reed and Jim Opdycke for cleaning this route and doing the first clean ascent after I fell in a dirt slide on the FA (also thanks to Jim for catching me and being wise enough to anchor himself to the log at the base). A great spot for children to learn; the 2nd ascent was followed by Wes's 4 year old daughter.
content.location: Belay from a downed tree at the base just to the west of the west trail. The ramp leads up and left from here.

climbs.name: 41 Feet of Pain
climbs.fa: Adam Winslow, Ujahn Davisson, Bill Coe, Jim Opdycke 4/4/09

content.description: A dirty climb, led from the ground up, that has probably never seen a second ascent. A good practice climb for Oregon moss and choss adventures, but with some cleaning this could be a nice easy route to practice on. Go Get On It!
content.protection: Welcome to Oregon ;-), bring your ice axe for this dirty climb. Standard rack with a big piece (#4).
content.location: Start in the dihedral that forms the left wall of the arena. Joins 30(1) Feet of Pleasure near the top, ducking under the fir tree and up to a large tree with slings and rings.

climbs.name: 30(1) Feet of Pleasure
climbs.fa: Adam Winslow, Bill Coe, Kyle Silverman 3/20/09

content.description: Start in the middle of the Arena and head up to a wide crack that slants slightly to the left. Duck under the horizontal fir tree to get to the slings and rings on the tree anchor. This climb was led ground up and is probably still dirty but has potential to be a good route for those looking for that alpine feel on an easy traditional climb.
content.protection: A few small pieces and a couple of large pieces will see you up this is safety.
